intro: Reussia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf reussia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its rounded, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Reussia rotundifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine in some regions.
